intro: Aquilegia flabellata f. flavida, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a hybrid form of the common columbine. It is characterized by its striking yellow petals that contrast with its blue or purple outer sepals. This cultivar is prized for its ornamental value in gardens and its ability to thrive in well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in early to mid-summer. It is a perennial that prefers full sun to partial shade and is relatively low maintenance once established.
